body_html:
I am having the exact same problems as @magic282 and @aluo-x when I try to build using your detailed instructions here: https://gist.github.com/peterjc123/a4ac6ce4b0ed4b1b497334baaeb595e3

pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/cuda/NativeFunctionsCuda.cu(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file:'ATen/NativeFunctions.h': No such file or directory [C:\optimae\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]

and

pytorch\torch\lib\libshm_windows\core.cpp(5): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'TH/TH.h': No such file or directory [C:\optimae\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\shm.vcxp
roj]

I have all prerequisites and follow each step exactly as stated, but these files cannot be found during the build process. The only workaround is to manually copy those files into the locations where the script is asking for them (so manually copying NativeFunctions.h from pytorch\aten\src\ATen\templates into pytorch\aten\src\ATen\native\cuda). If you do this, then it builds correctly.

Basically, various .h files required for the build at certain key steps are not in the correct places (another example: all of the .h files in pytorch\aten\doc need to be copied into pytorch\aten\src\ATen because ATen.h references them, and assumes they're in the same folder, but in fact, the are in aten\doc for some reason).

It appears that whatever script/build process is supposed to copy or move these required header files around during the build is not working correctly on Windows.
